caption:
Thanks to @chobani and @omsom, I made a delicious Burger out of a mashup of my two favorite flavors: Korean and Greek! I’ve been loving tzatziki sauce on my toasts last year, and I thought it would go so well in a burger with a Korean twist. Enjoy a juicy Korean Bulgogi burger with a creamy, refreshing, crunchy sauce.   🍔 Ingredients 🍔 • 1 cup of Chobani® Plain Whole Milk Greek Yogurt
• 1 cup of shredded cucumbers
• Handful of fresh dill
• Pinch of salt 
• Ground black pepper
• 1 tbsp olive oil 
• 1 toast
• 1/2 packet of Omsom Spicy Bulgogi Sauce 
• 150g (⅔ cup) ground beef
• 1/3 tsp baking powder
• Potato burger buns
• Lettuce
• Tomato 

🍴 Directions 🍴 1. Mix the ground beef with salt, pepper, and baking powder. Set aside.
2. Shred the cucumbers and mix with ½ tsp of kosher salt. Set aside for 5 minutes. 
3. Chop the dill into small pieces.
4. Place the shredded cucumbers in a paper towel and squeeze out the excess water.
5. In a bowl, mix the Greek Yogurt, cucumbers, dill, salt, and olive oil.
6. Shape and press the ground beef into a patty, and cook both sides on a heated oiled pan for 2 minutes on each side, or until browned.
7. Lower the heat to the lowest setting. Add ½ packet of Omsom Spicy Bulgogi sauce on top of the beef patty, and flip the patty several times while the sauce bubbles and glazes over the patty. For a well-done burger, lower the heat and put a lid on top of the pan for the meat to finish cooking.
8. On toasted buns, stack the spicy bulgogi patty, spread some tzatziki sauce, add tomato slices and some lettuce. Enjoy!

Chef’s Tip: For extra flavor, add a teaspoon of minced garlic to the tzatziki sauce before serving.

#koreanfusion #koreanfood #lunarnewyear
